info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:59PM EDT until July 24 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR OHIO...SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN...NORTHERN BOONE AND SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 459 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Aurora, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Fire Department reported quarter size hail in Aurora. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Villa Hills, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Shawnee, Delhi Township, Delhi Hills, Mack, Wilmington, French, Addyston, Hartford, Idlewild and Waterloo. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 179 and 182. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
